project.teaser: The main objective of GLocalFlex is to mobilise demand-response solutions & services in replicated manner for prompt horizontal scaling of flexible local energy systems (LES) by means of easy access and low barrier energy flexibility markets to increase the participation of...
project.objective: The main objective of GLocalFlex is to mobilise demand-response solutions & services in replicated manner for prompt horizontal scaling of flexible local energy systems (LES) by means of easy access and low barrier energy flexibility markets to increase the participation of the consumers across all energy-sectors. The GLocalFlex approach promotes viable interoperable solutions and products at all levels of the grid (consumers, producers, retailers, aggregators & market) by selecting modular standards and tools during development. It allows the overall system of systems to be 1) flexible by means of energy use to provide quality services to grid and 2) flexible by means of its own evolution (to change, upgrade or integrate several appliances, consumers and microgrids to create complex but viable cross-sectoral energy ecosystems). The GLocalFlex concept will allow any Local Energy System (LES), Positive Energy District(PED), community, or appliance to evolve in a consistent way and offer flexibility using suitable hardware add-ons in a cost-effective and systematic manner to expose their full flexible potential. GLocalFlex concept can adopt to any LES size, availability of local resources and regulations. This project will demonstrate near real time, large scale, flexibility trading in six different field locations in Europe. It has consumer and system centric pilots that develop flexibility services and replicate them within the pilot group. The GLocalFlex aims to have completely automated, machine-to-machine flexibility trading and flexibility order execution in LES by means of open, interoperable energy flexibility market and open standard based IT-tools that allows more flexibility consumers to join the market. Therefore, GLocalFlex will push forward the overall integration of disruptive renewable technologies and enhancing the stability of the grid at the same time.
project.title: A Global as well as Local Flexibility Marketplace to Demonstrate Grid Balancing Mechanisms through Cross-sectoral Interconnected and Integrated Energy Ecosystems enabling Automatic Flexibility Trading
project.keywords: Energy, Demand-Response, Flexibility market, interoperable energy marketplace

article.title: Disruptive renewable solutions at all levels of the grid

category.title: Project description

programme.title: Replicable solutions for a cross sector compliant energy ecosystem

category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

result.title: Pilot site testing objectives (SW)
result.description: Detailed pilot site descriptions including testing objectives considering business cases, national and European regulations, pilot specific KPIs as well as replication strategies.

result.title: Ethics Plan and Advisory Report
result.description: This deliverable comprises preliminary plan and two iterations. These iterations will be reported for the periodic reports of the project for M18 and M36. It describes all ethics compliance activities and EthAB meetings results for the period under review.

result.title: Review of applicable standards and recommendations for development
result.description: This will summarize applicable standards related to flexibility and formulate a synthesis a recommendation for practical design and implementation in WP2, WP3 and WP6

result.title: Toolset for replication road mapping
result.description: This document will describe the methodology proposed to establish flexibility roadmaps for replication sites. A first draft will be issued in M18 to serve as input to WP2 and WP3 replication work and be updated at the end of the project based on lessons learnt from the sites.

result.title: Catalogue of services, flexibility potential of appliances and business use cases
result.description: A simple and comprehensive catalogue of the flexibility potential for home appliances and other flexibility sources, tailor-made for specific consumer groups, together with potential products and services that can be provided in each case as well as the necessary interoperable hardware/software for providers and products. The catalogue works as an input for the design of catalogue on the marketplace in WP4.

result.title: Documentation of overall GLocalFlex marketplace technicities and communication specifications.
result.description: Software architecture of GLocalFlex marketplace & its communication protocol specification for the flexibility trading will be made public. This D4.1 will report the software development work carried out in T4.1, T4.2 & T4.3. TUDO will collect the info from VTT (T4.1 & T4.2) to make a combined report.

result.title: GLocalFlex, New Flexibility Solutions and Services. Cross-Pilot Overarching Business Use Cases

details.authors: Carlos Madina, Ines Gomez-Arriola, Maider Santos-Mugica, Amaia Gonzalez-Garrido,Pirkko Kuusela, Arttu Tamminen, Stephan Mehnert

result.title: Strategy and plan for dissemination, exploitation, including communication activities
result.description: Contains the description of the activities included in the dissemination, communication and exploitation plan. It will be updated throughout the project and submitted in three deliverables. The final update comprises all communication and dissemination activities and their impact throughout the project, including final conference.

result.title: Pilot site testing objectives (NE)
result.description: Detailed pilot site descriptions including testing objectives considering business cases, national and European regulations, pilot specific KPIs as well as replication strategies.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - GLocalFlex (A Global as well as Local Flexibility Marketplace to Demonstrate Grid Balancing Mechanisms through Cross-sectoral Interconnected and Integrated Energy Ecosystems enabling Automatic Flexibility Trading)
result.teaser: GLocalFlex aims to scale flexible local energy systems (LES) by making energy flexibility markets easily accessible and low-barrier, encouraging consumer participation across all energy sectors. It promotes interoperable solutions at all grid levels (consumers, producers...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
